result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy Sue Schlapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 in 14CF435, but Concurrent with Count 3 in 14CF435.

miscConds.notes: Complete psychological Evaluation & comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain full-time school or employment. Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety, pertains to both drugs and alcohol. Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Sue Schlapman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: April 5, 2016 plea hearing filed by Dorothy Campbell
8-30-16 sentencing hrg filed by Court Reporter Cathy Braunschweig
7-1-2016 sentence reset filed by court reporter Marjorie Kurtz

Cases called: 15CF524, 16CF65 & 14CF435, Defendant Tammy Sue Schlapman in court, in custody with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, read defendant's lengthy record. Sentencing statement by Atty. Hughes. Statement by defendant. 14CF435, count 1, Court sentenced defendant to 8 years prison, consisting of 4 years  confinement  &  4 years extended supervision with conditions:  Complete psychological Evaluation & comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain full-time school or employment. Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety, pertains to both drugs and alcohol. $518 costs Submit DNA sample. IS ELIGIBLE FOR SUBSTANCE AND BOOT CAMP. (233 days jail credit on Count 1)  On Count 3, sentence withheld, 5 years probation, consecutive to count 1 with $268 costs and conditions of Extended Supervision in 14CF435. In 15CF524, on Count 1, sentence withheld, 5 years Probation, consecutive  to count 1 in 14CF435, but concurrent with probation in 14CF435, Submit DNA sample. $518 costs, and conditions of Extended Supervision in 14CF435. In 16CF65, $518 costs. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit 16CF65 & 15CF524. Court adjourned at 4:55 p.m.

Cases called: 14CF435, 15CF524 & 16CF65, Defendant Tammy Sue Schlapman in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, stated the PSI is incomplete - only addressed one case. Atty. Hughes stated he contacted probation. The agent stated she addressed all cases; they were not specifically stated. Court found good cause to order DOC to update the PSI within 30 days and file corrected report.
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey, requesting a reset of the sentencing hearing currently set for 7-1-16 - due to insufficient PSI.

Defendant Tammy Sue Schlapman in court, in custody with attorney Michael Hughes.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF65, 15CF524, and 14CF435.  Information filed in 16CF65 and 15CF524.  Reading waived.  In 16CF65 and 15CF524 Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 3 of 14CF435, and 15CF524, and no contest to Ct. 1 of 16CF65.  Court found guilty.  Cts. 2,4, & 5 of14CF435 and Ct. 2 of 16CF65 dismissed but read in.  PSI requested with argued sentencing.  Court ordered PSI.  To be completed in 60 days.
ADA Yaskal discovery letter to Atty. Hughes
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Yaskal
ADA Yaskal discovery letter to Atty. Hughes
standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription

Defendant, Tammy Sue Schlapman, appeared with Atty. Michael Hughes. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $10,000 recog. with felony conds and   Not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
